system.description: You send your mind to another plane of existence to receive advice from an entity there. The entity may be a deity, an outsider, the spirit of a dead sage, or some other mysterious being. The entity answers in a language you understand, but often briefly and cryptically. You may ask one question per two caster levels. The base chance of a correct answer is 70%; 5% per caster level above 12th. If the roll fails, you get "no answer" (50% chance) or a random answer (50%). No answer is stressful: you take 1d6 points of Intelligence and Wisdom drain. A random answer is as likely to be wrong as right. If the entity does not know the answer, it says so. Draining your Intelligence to 0 or Wisdom to 0 makes you comatose.
